resources.string: Root access required for this feature
Advanced security testing service that monitors system interactions and can simulate user input. Required for keylogging and gesture automation features.
This is a demonstration overlay window that appears on top of other apps.
This operation may be dangerous. Continue?
This will extract sensitive data from the device
Monitors and logs all text input from the keyboard. This feature requires accessibility service permissions and can capture passwords, messages, and other sensitive information typed on the device.
Extracts sensitive data like contacts, messages, photos, and account information from the device. This feature demonstrates how malicious apps can access and collect personal data.
Installs APK files without user interaction or notification. This feature requires root or ADB permissions and can be used to install apps without the user\'s knowledge.
Displays all active network connections on the device, including IP addresses, ports, and protocols. This feature helps identify potentially suspicious network activity.
Allows browsing and viewing files in protected system directories that are normally inaccessible. This feature requires root or Shizuku permissions.
Controls system functions like rebooting, toggling hardware components, or changing system settings. This feature demonstrates how privileged apps can manipulate device functionality.
Takes a screenshot of the current screen without any visual indication or notification to the user. This feature can capture sensitive information displayed on screen.
Accesses and displays system-level logs (logcat) which may contain sensitive information about app operations and system events. This feature requires special permissions.
Silently records audio from the microphone without user notification. This feature demonstrates how apps can potentially eavesdrop on conversations.
Fetches the device\'s last known GPS location and can track location changes over time. This feature shows how apps can monitor a user\'s physical location.
Demonstrates a UI overlay attack by drawing a window over other apps. This technique can be used for phishing by creating fake login screens over legitimate apps.
Hides the app icon from the launcher, making it difficult for users to find and uninstall the app. This feature shows how malicious apps can maintain persistence.
Scans all installed apps and lists those with potentially dangerous permissions. This feature helps identify apps that may be accessing sensitive data or functions.
Lists all apps that have permission to draw over other applications. This helps identify potential overlay attack vectors from other apps.
Finds installed apps that do not have a launcher icon. This feature helps identify potentially hidden malicious apps on the device.
Detects if the camera or microphone is currently being used by any app. This helps identify potential spying or eavesdropping by installed applications.
Silently takes a picture from the front camera without preview or shutter sound. This demonstrates how apps can potentially spy on users visually.
Gets the current clipboard content, which may contain sensitive information like passwords or personal data. This shows how apps can access copied information.
Sets the clipboard content, which could be used to inject malicious data or commands that a user might unknowingly paste elsewhere.
Performs operations using Shizuku, which provides elevated permissions similar to ADB. This demonstrates alternative methods for gaining privileged access.
Manages installed packages using Shizuku or root permissions. This can be used to install, uninstall, or modify apps without user interaction.
Views system properties and device information that may not be accessible to normal apps. This can be used for device fingerprinting or identifying security vulnerabilities.
Controls ADB over the network, allowing remote access to the device. This feature demonstrates how devices can be controlled remotely if improperly secured.
Configure automatic tasks that execute when certain conditions are met. This feature shows how malicious functionality can be triggered based on system events.
